intro: Camellia speciosa, commonly known as the Chinese camellia, is a flowering plant native to southern China and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep red, often with a contrasting central band. The plant is an evergreen shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of 3 to 6 meters. Its leaves are glossy, elliptical, and arranged alternately along the stem. Camellia speciosa thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
